::: {.container .py-3 .px-4 .rounded style="background-color: #D9E3E8"}

<p style="font-size:22px; line-height: 2rem">The Deportation Data Project collects and posts public, anonymized U.S. government immigration enforcement datasets. We expect these datasets to be used by journalists, researchers, lawyers, and policymakers.</p>

::: {.grid}

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4}

### {{< bi card-checklist class="me-2" >}} Obtaining 

We obtain immigration enforcement data from the U.S. government, primarily through Freedom of Information Act requests. 

[Explore requests](/foia.html){.btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm role="button"} 

:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4}

### {{< bi file-earmark-arrow-up class="me-2" >}} Posting

We share datasets that we obtain, that the government posts proactively in response to other requests, and that others share with us.

[Download data](/data.html){.btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm role="button"} 

:::

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4 .g-col-lg-4}

### {{< bi journal-text class="me-2" >}} Explaining

We document the data we post. We write codebooks and post internal documentation from the agencies.

[Read data guide](/guide.html){.btn-action-primary .btn-action .btn .btn-outline-primary .btn-sm role="button"} 

:::

<!-- /grid-->
:::

<p></p>

**Questions about the most recent ICE data release? Please start with our [ICE data FAQ](https://deportationdata.org/docs/ice.html#faq){.bold-link}.**

<!-- /div -->
